intro: Licaria aureosericea, commonly known as the golden feather plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and silky, hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique appearance.
